question.title: Finding all rows where a jsonb field filled with an array has the same element at the first position
question.body:
Essentially, I have a table in my database, where one column has the type jsonb. This column is filled with an list of IDs, with which a branch in a tree structure is described.

What I want to do is to select all rows, where the first element of that list is the same as an input parameter.

My first approach was to use createNativeQuery(), but circumstances demand that the select is made with a JPA query using createQuery().

My sql query reads like select * from my_table where (jsonb_field ->> 0)::bigint = ?, how would I be able to achieve the same effect with a JPA query?
